Note: Includes Vbi sunt verses: ‘Uuere beþ they biforen vs weren’, etc., last seven stanzas. For another version which lacks the two introductory stanzas see 4564.
_description: The Sayings of St. Bernard: Man’s Three Foes — in 6-line stanzas (aabccb)

BodAddE6.First Lines:
Þe blessyngge of þe hewene kyngAnd of his moder þat
                    swete þyng…
BodAddE6.Last Lines:
…Þat we mowenþy sone ysenIn ioȝe wyd outen
                    ende
BodAddE6.Note:
First poem on a parchment roll. At the start of the poem, Assit
                        principio sancta maria meo; the same line is repeated at the end of the
                    poem.
